meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a win
meanings.sent1: The winish trophy sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: Her smile had a winish glow of happiness.
meanings.sent3: The cake had a winish decoration made of gold stars.
meanings.sent4: The winish sunset painted the sky in shades of pink and gold.
meanings.sent5: The winish aroma of freshly baked bread filled the room.

meanings.definition: Tending to win or achieve victory
meanings.sent1: His winish attitude inspired the team to keep going.
meanings.sent2: The athlete had a winish determination to succeed.
meanings.sent3: The cat had a winish strategy to catch the mouse.
meanings.sent4: Her winish spirit never wavered in the face of challenges.
meanings.sent5: The winish cheers of the crowd motivated the players.

meanings.sent1: She hoped to winish her way to the top of the mountain.
meanings.sent2: The plant began to winish and grow towards the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The car seemed to winish its way through the heavy traffic.
meanings.sent4: The idea started to winish in his mind, growing stronger with each thought.
meanings.sent5: The friendship continued to winish over time, becoming deeper and more meaningful.
